intro: Cryptantha capituliflora, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, oval pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Cryptantha capituliflora is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
